file.content:
# Sivera

**AI-Powered Interview Platform — Let Sia Handle the First Round**

Sivera is an intelligent interview automation platform that streamlines technical and non-technical hiring through AI-driven voice interviews. The platform connects recruiters with candidates via **Sia**, an AI interviewer that conducts real-time voice-based screening interviews, evaluates responses, and delivers structured analytics.

---

## Table of Contents

- [Overview](#overview)
- [Architecture](#architecture)
- [Tech Stack](#tech-stack)
- [Project Structure](#project-structure)
- [Features](#features)
- [Getting Started](#getting-started)
- [Environment Variables](#environment-variables)
- [Deployment](#deployment)
- [Contributing](#contributing)
- [License](#license)

---

## Overview

Sivera consists of four core services:

| Service | Description | URL |
|---------|-------------|-----|
| **Candidate App** | Next.js app where candidates complete AI voice interviews | `app.sivera.io` |
| **Recruiter Dashboard** | Next.js app for managing interviews, candidates, and analytics | `recruiter.sivera.io` |
| **Interview Backend** | FastAPI service powering the AI voice agent (Pipecat) | `core.sivera.io` |
| **Recruiter Backend** | FastAPI service handling CRUD, auth, scheduling, and analytics | `api.sivera.io` |

---

## Architecture

```
                    ┌─────────────────────┐
                    │   Recruiter creates  │
                    │   interview workflow │
                    └──────────┬──────────┘
                               │
              ┌────────────────▼────────────────┐
              │      Recruiter Dashboard         │
              │      (Next.js 15 + React 19)     │
              └────────────────┬────────────────┘
                               │ REST API
              ┌────────────────▼────────────────┐
              │      Recruiter Backend           │
              │      (FastAPI + Supabase)        │
              │  - Interview CRUD                │
              │  - Candidate management          │
              │  - Email invitations (Loops)     │
              │  - Analytics & scoring           │
              │  - Phone screen scheduling       │
              └────────────────┬────────────────┘
                               │
            Invitation email   │   Token-based link
                               ▼
              ┌────────────────────────────────┐
              │        Candidate App            │
              │      (Next.js 15 + React 19)    │
              │  - Token verification           │
              │  - Registration & permissions    │
              │  - Voice interview UI            │
              │  - Code editor (Monaco)          │
              │  - Screen recording              │
              └────────────────┬───────────────┘
                               │ WebSocket / Daily.co
              ┌────────────────▼────────────────┐
              │      Interview Backend           │
              │      (FastAPI + Pipecat AI)      │
              │  - Real-time voice agent (Sia)   │
              │  - STT (Deepgram / Google)       │
              │  - TTS (ElevenLabs / Cartesia)   │
              │  - LLM (Gemini / GPT-4 / Groq)  │
              │  - Transcript & evaluation       │
              └────────────────────────────────┘
```

---

## Tech Stack

### Frontend
| Technology | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| Next.js 15 | React framework with App Router |
| React 19 | UI library |
| TypeScript | Type safety |
| Tailwind CSS 4 | Utility-first styling |
| Shadcn/UI + Radix | Component library |
| Zustand | Client state management |
| TanStack React Query | Server state & caching |
| Framer Motion | Animations |
| Recharts | Data visualization |
| Monaco Editor | In-browser code editor |
| React Flow | Visual interview flow builder |
| Daily.co + Pipecat Client | Real-time voice/video |

### Backend
| Technology | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| FastAPI | Python async web framework |
| Supabase | Auth, PostgreSQL database, real-time |
| Drizzle ORM | TypeScript database queries |
| Pipecat AI | Voice agent orchestration |
| LlamaIndex | RAG for context-aware responses |

### AI & Voice
| Technology | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| Google Gemini 2.0 Flash | Primary LLM |
| OpenAI GPT-4 | Alternative LLM |
| Groq | Low-latency LLM inference |
| Anthropic Claude | Alternative LLM |
| Deepgram | Speech-to-text |
| ElevenLabs | Text-to-speech |
| Cartesia | Text-to-speech |
| Google STT/TTS | Speech services |

### Infrastructure
| Technology | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| Docker | Containerization |
| GitHub Actions | CI/CD pipelines |
| AWS EC2 | Compute hosting |
| AWS S3 + CloudFront | Recording storage & CDN |
| Vercel | Frontend hosting |
| Loops.so | Transactional email |

---

## Project Structure

```
core/
├── frontend/                       # Candidate Interview App
│   ├── app/
│   │   ├── page.tsx               # Entry point
│   │   ├── interview/page.tsx     # Interview flow (token, registration, permissions)
│   │   ├── round/page.tsx         # Multi-round selection
│   │   └── components/
│   │       └── flowterview/       # Interview components
│   │           ├── main-component.tsx        # Core interview orchestrator
│   │           ├── audio-client.tsx          # Voice interaction handler
│   │           ├── CodingEditor.tsx          # Monaco code editor
│   │           ├── JupyterNotebook.tsx       # Jupyter integration
│   │           ├── screen-recorder-optimized.tsx  # Screen recording
│   │           └── conclusion-section.tsx    # Interview wrap-up
│   ├── package.json
│   ├── tailwind.config.ts
│   └── next.config.ts
│
├── flowterview-app/                # Recruiter Dashboard App
│   └── src/app/
│       ├── auth/                  # Login, signup, OAuth callbacks
│       └── dashboard/
│           ├── page.tsx           # Overview with stats
│           ├── interviews/        # Interview CRUD & flow builder
│           ├── candidates/        # Candidate management & bulk invite
│           ├── analytics/         # Charts, completion rates, scores
│           └── settings/          # Organization configuration
│
├── backend/                        # Interview Voice Backend
│   ├── main.py                    # FastAPI entry point
│   └── src/
│       ├── router/path_router.py  # WebSocket voice endpoint
│       ├── services/              # Bot configuration & orchestration
│       ├── llm_handler/           # Multi-LLM integration
│       └── lib/manager.py         # Daily.co room management
│
├── flowterview-backend/            # Recruiter API Backend
│   ├── main.py                    # FastAPI entry point
│   └── src/
│       ├── router/                # REST API endpoints
│       │   ├── interview_router.py
│       │   ├── candidate_router.py
│       │   ├── invites_router.py
│       │   ├── analytics_router.py
│       │   ├── recording_router.py
│       │   ├── phone_screen_router.py
│       │   └── organization_router.py
│       ├── services/              # Business logic
│       └── utils/
│           ├── auth_middleware.py
│           └── llm_factory.py     # LLM provider abstraction
│
├── docker-compose.candidate.yml    # Docker: candidate services
├── docker-compose.recruiter.yml    # Docker: recruiter services
└── .github/workflows/
    ├── main-app-deploy.yml        # CI/CD: candidate app
    └── recruiter-app-deploy.yml   # CI/CD: recruiter app
```

---

## Features

### For Candidates

- **AI Voice Interviews** — Real-time conversation with Sia, the AI interviewer, using natural voice interaction
- **Coding Challenges** — Integrated Monaco code editor with syntax highlighting and multi-language support
- **Jupyter Notebooks** — Interactive Python notebook environment for data-focused roles
- **Screen Recording** — Automatic session recording with secure upload to cloud storage
- **Multi-Round Support** — Complete multiple interview rounds with distinct focus areas
- **Token-Based Access** — Secure, one-time invitation links with verification

### For Recruiters

- **Visual Interview Builder** — Drag-and-drop interview flow editor powered by React Flow
- **Auto-Generate from Job Description** — Paste a JD and let AI create a complete interview workflow
- **Candidate Management** — Track candidate status, search, filter, and perform bulk operations
- **Bulk Invitations** — Send interview invitations to multiple candidates via email
- **Analytics Dashboard** — Completion rates, performance scores, satisfaction ratings, and trend analysis
- **Phone Screen Scheduling** — Automated scheduling with timezone support
- **Multi-Tenant Organizations** — Isolated workspaces with role-based access (Admin, Interviewer)
- **LinkedIn Integration** — OAuth login and candidate profile import
- **Recording Playback** — Review candidate interview recordings and transcripts

---

## Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- Node.js 18+
- Python 3.12+
- Docker & Docker Compose (for containerized setup)
- PostgreSQL (via Supabase)

### Candidate App (frontend)

```bash
cd frontend
npm install
npm run dev
```

Runs on `http://localhost:3000`

### Recruiter Dashboard (flowterview-app)

```bash
cd flowterview-app
npm install
npm run dev
```

Runs on `http://localhost:3001`

### Interview Backend (backend)

```bash
cd backend
pip install -r requirements.txt
uvicorn main:app --reload --port 8000
```

### Recruiter Backend (flowterview-backend)

```bash
cd flowterview-backend
pip install -r requirements.txt
uvicorn main:app --reload --port 8001
```

### Docker Setup

```bash
# Candidate services
docker-compose -f docker-compose.candidate.yml up --build

# Recruiter services
docker-compose -f docker-compose.recruiter.yml up --build
```

---

## Environment Variables

Each service requires its own `.env` file. Key variables include:

### Frontend Apps
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=
NEXT_PUBLIC_DAILY_API_KEY=
```

### Backend Services
```
SUPABASE_URL=
SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=
DAILY_API_KEY=
OPENAI_API_KEY=
GOOGLE_API_KEY=
DEEPGRAM_API_KEY=
ELEVENLABS_API_KEY=
CARTESIA_API_KEY=
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=
AWS_S3_BUCKET=
LOOPS_API_KEY=
```

> Refer to each service's config file for the complete list of required variables.

---

## Deployment

### CI/CD

GitHub Actions workflows handle automated deployment:

- **`main-app-deploy.yml`** — Builds and deploys the candidate app and interview backend to AWS EC2
- **`recruiter-app-deploy.yml`** — Builds and deploys the recruiter dashboard and API backend

### Production URLs

| Service | URL |
|---------|-----|

content.content:
1→# Sivera
     2→
     3→**AI-Powered Interview Platform — Let Sia Handle the First Round**
     4→
     5→Sivera is an intelligent interview automation platform that streamlines technical and non-technical hiring through AI-driven voice interviews. The platform connects recruiters with candidates via **Sia**, an AI interviewer that conducts real-time voice-based screening interviews, evaluates responses, and delivers structured analytics.
     6→
     7→---
     8→
     9→## Table of Contents
    10→
    11→- [Overview](#overview)
    12→- [Architecture](#architecture)
    13→- [Tech Stack](#tech-stack)
    14→- [Project Structure](#project-structure)
    15→- [Features](#features)
    16→- [Getting Started](#getting-started)
    17→- [Environment Variables](#environment-variables)
    18→- [Deployment](#deployment)
    19→- [Contributing](#contributing)
    20→- [License](#license)
    21→
    22→---
    23→
    24→## Overview
    25→
    26→Sivera consists of four core services:
    27→
    28→| Service | Description | URL |
    29→|---------|-------------|-----|
    30→| **Candidate App** | Next.js app where candidates complete AI voice interviews | `app.sivera.io` |
    31→| **Recruiter Dashboard** | Next.js app for managing interviews, candidates, and analytics | `recruiter.sivera.io` |
    32→| **Interview Backend** | FastAPI service powering the AI voice agent (Pipecat) | `core.sivera.io` |
    33→| **Recruiter Backend** | FastAPI service handling CRUD, auth, scheduling, and analytics | `api.sivera.io` |
    34→
    35→---
    36→
    37→## Architecture
    38→
    39→```
    40→                    ┌─────────────────────┐
    41→                    │   Recruiter creates  │
    42→                    │   interview workflow │
    43→                    └──────────┬──────────┘
    44→                               │
    45→              ┌────────────────▼────────────────┐
    46→              │      Recruiter Dashboard         │
    47→              │      (Next.js 15 + React 19)     │
    48→              └────────────────┬────────────────┘
    49→                               │ REST API
    50→              ┌────────────────▼────────────────┐
    51→              │      Recruiter Backend           │
    52→              │      (FastAPI + Supabase)        │
    53→              │  - Interview CRUD                │
    54→              │  - Candidate management          │
    55→              │  - Email invitations (Loops)     │
    56→              │  - Analytics & scoring           │
    57→              │  - Phone screen scheduling       │
    58→              └────────────────┬────────────────┘
    59→                               │
    60→            Invitation email   │   Token-based link
    61→                               ▼
    62→              ┌────────────────────────────────┐
    63→              │        Candidate App            │
    64→              │      (Next.js 15 + React 19)    │
    65→              │  - Token verification           │
    66→              │  - Registration & permissions    │
    67→              │  - Voice interview UI            │
    68→              │  - Code editor (Monaco)          │
    69→              │  - Screen recording              │
    70→              └────────────────┬───────────────┘
    71→                               │ WebSocket / Daily.co
    72→              ┌────────────────▼────────────────┐
    73→              │      Interview Backend           │
    74→              │      (FastAPI + Pipecat AI)      │
    75→              │  - Real-time voice agent (Sia)   │
    76→              │  - STT (Deepgram / Google)       │
    77→              │  - TTS (ElevenLabs / Cartesia)   │
    78→              │  - LLM (Gemini / GPT-4 / Groq)  │
    79→              │  - Transcript & evaluation       │
    80→              └────────────────────────────────┘
    81→```
    82→
    83→---
    84→
    85→## Tech Stack
    86→
    87→### Frontend
    88→| Technology | Purpose |
    89→|-----------|---------|
    90→| Next.js 15 | React framework with App Router |
    91→| React 19 | UI library |
    92→| TypeScript | Type safety |
    93→| Tailwind CSS 4 | Utility-first styling |
    94→| Shadcn/UI + Radix | Component library |
    95→| Zustand | Client state management |
    96→| TanStack React Query | Server state & caching |
    97→| Framer Motion | Animations |
    98→| Recharts | Data visualization |
    99→| Monaco Editor | In-browser code editor |
   100→| React Flow | Visual interview flow builder |
   101→| Daily.co + Pipecat Client | Real-time voice/video |
   102→
   103→### Backend
   104→| Technology | Purpose |
   105→|-----------|---------|
   106→| FastAPI | Python async web framework |
   107→| Supabase | Auth, PostgreSQL database, real-time |
   108→| Drizzle ORM | TypeScript database queries |
   109→| Pipecat AI | Voice agent orchestration |
   110→| LlamaIndex | RAG for context-aware responses |
   111→
   112→### AI & Voice
   113→| Technology | Purpose |
   114→|-----------|---------|
   115→| Google Gemini 2.0 Flash | Primary LLM |
   116→| OpenAI GPT-4 | Alternative LLM |
   117→| Groq | Low-latency LLM inference |
   118→| Anthropic Claude | Alternative LLM |
   119→| Deepgram | Speech-to-text |
   120→| ElevenLabs | Text-to-speech |
   121→| Cartesia | Text-to-speech |
   122→| Google STT/TTS | Speech services |
   123→
   124→### Infrastructure
   125→| Technology | Purpose |
   126→|-----------|---------|
   127→| Docker | Containerization |
   128→| GitHub Actions | CI/CD pipelines |
   129→| AWS EC2 | Compute hosting |
   130→| AWS S3 + CloudFront | Recording storage & CDN |
   131→| Vercel | Frontend hosting |
   132→| Loops.so | Transactional email |
   133→
   134→---
   135→
   136→## Project Structure
   137→
   138→```
   139→core/
   140→├── frontend/                       # Candidate Interview App
   141→│   ├── app/
   142→│   │   ├── page.tsx               # Entry point
   143→│   │   ├── interview/page.tsx     # Interview flow (token, registration, permissions)
   144→│   │   ├── round/page.tsx         # Multi-round selection
   145→│   │   └── components/
   146→│   │       └── flowterview/       # Interview components
   147→│   │           ├── main-component.tsx        # Core interview orchestrator
   148→│   │           ├── audio-client.tsx          # Voice interaction handler
   149→│   │           ├── CodingEditor.tsx          # Monaco code editor
   150→│   │           ├── JupyterNotebook.tsx       # Jupyter integration
   151→│   │           ├── screen-recorder-optimized.tsx  # Screen recording
   152→│   │           └── conclusion-section.tsx    # Interview wrap-up
   153→│   ├── package.json
   154→│   ├── tailwind.config.ts
   155→│   └── next.config.ts
   156→│
   157→├── flowterview-app/                # Recruiter Dashboard App
   158→│   └── src/app/
   159→│       ├── auth/                  # Login, signup, OAuth callbacks
   160→│       └── dashboard/
   161→│           ├── page.tsx           # Overview with stats
   162→│           ├── interviews/        # Interview CRUD & flow builder
   163→│           ├── candidates/        # Candidate management & bulk invite
   164→│           ├── analytics/         # Charts, completion rates, scores
   165→│           └── settings/          # Organization configuration
   166→│
   167→├── backend/                        # Interview Voice Backend
   168→│   ├── main.py                    # FastAPI entry point
   169→│   └── src/
   170→│       ├── router/path_router.py  # WebSocket voice endpoint
   171→│       ├── services/              # Bot configuration & orchestration
   172→│       ├── llm_handler/           # Multi-LLM integration
   173→│       └── lib/manager.py         # Daily.co room management
   174→│
   175→├── flowterview-backend/            # Recruiter API Backend
   176→│   ├── main.py                    # FastAPI entry point
   177→│   └── src/
   178→│       ├── router/                # REST API endpoints
   179→│       │   ├── interview_router.py
   180→│       │   ├── candidate_router.py
   181→│       │   ├── invites_router.py
   182→│       │   ├── analytics_router.py
   183→│       │   ├── recording_router.py
   184→│       │   ├── phone_screen_router.py
   185→│       │   └── organization_router.py
   186→│       ├── services/              # Business logic
   187→│       └── utils/
   188→│           ├── auth_middleware.py
   189→│           └── llm_factory.py     # LLM provider abstraction
   190→│
   191→├── docker-compose.candidate.yml    # Docker: candidate services
   192→├── docker-compose.recruiter.yml    # Docker: recruiter services
   193→└── .github/workflows/
   194→    ├── main-app-deploy.yml        # CI/CD: candidate app
   195→    └── recruiter-app-deploy.yml   # CI/CD: recruiter app
   196→```
   197→
   198→---
   199→
   200→## Features
   201→
   202→### For Candidates
   203→
   204→- **AI Voice Interviews** — Real-time conversation with Sia, the AI interviewer, using natural voice interaction
   205→- **Coding Challenges** — Integrated Monaco code editor with syntax highlighting and multi-language support
   206→- **Jupyter Notebooks** — Interactive Python notebook environment for data-focused roles
   207→- **Screen Recording** — Automatic session recording with secure upload to cloud storage
   208→- **Multi-Round Support** — Complete multiple interview rounds with distinct focus areas
   209→- **Token-Based Access** — Secure, one-time invitation links with verification
   210→
   211→### For Recruiters
   212→
   213→- **Visual Interview Builder** — Drag-and-drop interview flow editor powered by React Flow
   214→- **Auto-Generate from Job Description** — Paste a JD and let AI create a complete interview workflow
   215→- **Candidate Management** — Track candidate status, search, filter, and perform bulk operations
   216→- **Bulk Invitations** — Send interview invitations to multiple candidates via email
   217→- **Analytics Dashboard** — Completion rates, performance scores, satisfaction ratings, and trend analysis
   218→- **Phone Screen Scheduling** — Automated scheduling with timezone support
   219→- **Multi-Tenant Organizations** — Isolated workspaces with role-based access (Admin, Interviewer)
   220→- **LinkedIn Integration** — OAuth login and candidate profile import
   221→- **Recording Playback** — Review candidate interview recordings and transcripts
   222→
   223→---
   224→
   225→## Getting Started
   226→
   227→### Prerequisites
   228→
   229→- Node.js 18+
   230→- Python 3.12+
   231→- Docker & Docker Compose (for containerized setup)
   232→- PostgreSQL (via Supabase)
   233→
   234→### Candidate App (frontend)
   235→
   236→```bash
   237→cd frontend
   238→npm install
   239→npm run dev
   240→```
   241→
   242→Runs on `http://localhost:3000`
   243→
   244→### Recruiter Dashboard (flowterview-app)
   245→
   246→```bash
   247→cd flowterview-app
   248→npm install
   249→npm run dev
   250→```
   251→
   252→Runs on `http://localhost:3001`
   253→
   254→### Interview Backend (backend)
   255→
   256→```bash
   257→cd backend
   258→pip install -r requirements.txt
   259→uvicorn main:app --reload --port 8000
   260→```
   261→
   262→### Recruiter Backend (flowterview-backend)
   263→
   264→```bash
   265→cd flowterview-backend
   266→pip install -r requirements.txt
   267→uvicorn main:app --reload --port 8001
   268→```
   269→
   270→### Docker Setup
   271→
   272→```bash
   273→# Candidate services
   274→docker-compose -f docker-compose.candidate.yml up --build
   275→
   276→# Recruiter services
   277→docker-compose -f docker-compose.recruiter.yml up --build
   278→```
   279→
   280→---
   281→
   282→## Environment Variables
   283→
   284→Each service requires its own `.env` file. Key variables include:
   285→
   286→### Frontend Apps
   287→```
   288→NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=
   289→NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=
   290→NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=
   291→NEXT_PUBLIC_DAILY_API_KEY=
   292→```
   293→
   294→### Backend Services
   295→```
   296→SUPABASE_URL=
   297→SUPABASE_SERVICE_KEY=
   298→DAILY_API_KEY=
   299→OPENAI_API_KEY=
   300→GOOGLE_API_KEY=
   301→DEEPGRAM_API_KEY=

1→name: Deploy Main App
     2→
     3→# Trigger rebuild with corrected HTTPS URLs - Sept 8, 2025
     4→
     5→on:
     6→  push:
     7→    branches: [ main, master ]
     8→    paths:
     9→      - 'backend/**'
    10→      - 'frontend/**'
    11→      - '.github/workflows/main-app-deploy.yml'
    12→
    13→jobs:
    14→  build-and-deploy:
    15→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    16→
    17→    steps:
    18→      - name: Checkout code
    19→        uses: actions/checkout@v3
    20→
    21→      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
    22→        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v2
    23→
    24→      - name: Login to Docker Hub
    25→        uses: docker/login-action@v2
    26→        with:
    27→          username: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}
    28→          password: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}
    29→
    30→      - name: Build and push backend image
    31→        uses: docker/build-push-action@v4
    32→        with:
    33→          context: ./backend
    34→          push: true
    35→          tags: sivera/sivera:backend
    36→          cache-from: type=registry,ref=sivera/sivera:backend-cache
    37→          cache-to: type=registry,ref=sivera/sivera:backend-cache,mode=max
    38→          build-args: |
    39→            SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
    40→            SUPABASE_KEY=${{ secrets.SUPABASE_KEY }}
    41→            DAILY_API_KEY=${{ secrets.DAILY_API_KEY }}
    42→
    43→      - name: Build and push frontend image
    44→        uses: docker/build-push-action@v4
    45→        with:
    46→          context: ./frontend
    47→          push: true
    48→          tags: sivera/sivera:frontend
    49→          cache-from: type=registry,ref=sivera/sivera:frontend-cache
    50→          cache-to: type=registry,ref=sivera/sivera:frontend-cache,mode=max
    51→          build-args: |
    52→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL }}
    53→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
    54→            DATABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}
    55→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL }}
    56→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL }}
    57→            NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL }}
    58→            NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL }}
    59→
    60→      - name: Deploy to AWS EC2
    61→        uses: appleboy/ssh-action@v1.0.0
    62→        with:
    63→          host: ${{ secrets.AWS_MAIN_APP_HOST }}
    64→          username: ${{ secrets.MAIN_APP_VM_USER }}
    65→          key: ${{ secrets.AWS_MAIN_SSH_PRIVATE_KEY }}
    66→          script_stop: true
    67→          script: |
    68→            mkdir -p /home/${{ secrets.MAIN_APP_VM_USER }}/sivera-main-application
    69→            sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /home/${{ secrets.MAIN_APP_VM_USER }}/sivera-main-application
    70→            sudo chmod -R 755 /home/${{ secrets.MAIN_APP_VM_USER }}/sivera-main-application
    71→
    72→            DOCKER_COMPOSE="docker-compose"
    73→
    74→            echo "${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}" | docker login -u "${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}" --password-stdin
    75→
    76→            cd /home/${{ secrets.MAIN_APP_VM_USER }}/sivera-main-application
    77→            $DOCKER_COMPOSE pull || true
    78→            $DOCKER_COMPOSE down || true
    79→
    80→            cat > .env.backend << EOF
    81→            OPENAI_API_KEY=${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }}
    82→            GEMINI_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GEMINI_API_KEY }}
    83→            GROQ_API_KEY=${{ secrets.GROQ_API_KEY }}
    84→            ELEVENLABS_API_KEY=${{ secrets.ELEVENLABS_API_KEY }}
    85→            DAILY_API_KEY=${{ secrets.DAILY_API_KEY }}
    86→            RIME_API_KEY=${{ secrets.RIME_API_KEY }}
    87→            DEEPGRAM_API_KEY=${{ secrets.DEEPGRAM_API_KEY }}
    88→            SMTP_HOST=${{ secrets.SMTP_HOST }}
    89→            SMTP_PORT=${{ secrets.SMTP_PORT }}
    90→            SMTP_USER=${{ secrets.SMTP_USER }}
    91→            SMTP_PASS=${{ secrets.SMTP_PASS }}
    92→            SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.SUPABASE_URL }}
    93→            SUPABASE_KEY=${{ secrets.SUPABASE_KEY }}
    94→            RELOAD=false
    95→            EOF
    96→
    97→            cat > .env.frontend << EOF
    98→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL }}
    99→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY }}
   100→            DATABASE_URL=${{ secrets.DATABASE_URL }}
   101→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL }}
   102→            NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL }}
   103→            NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL }}
   104→            NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL=${{ secrets.NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL }}
   105→            EOF
   106→
   107→            echo "# Main application deployment configuration" > docker-compose.yml
   108→            echo "services:" >> docker-compose.yml
   109→            echo "  backend:" >> docker-compose.yml
   110→            echo "    image: sivera/sivera:backend" >> docker-compose.yml
   111→            echo "    pull_policy: always" >> docker-compose.yml
   112→            echo "    ports:" >> docker-compose.yml
   113→            echo "      - \"8000:8000\"" >> docker-compose.yml
   114→            echo "    restart: always" >> docker-compose.yml
   115→            echo "    env_file:" >> docker-compose.yml
   116→            echo "      - .env.backend" >> docker-compose.yml
   117→            echo "  frontend:" >> docker-compose.yml
   118→            echo "    image: sivera/sivera:frontend" >> docker-compose.yml
   119→            echo "    pull_policy: always" >> docker-compose.yml
   120→            echo "    ports:" >> docker-compose.yml
   121→            echo "      - \"3001:3000\"" >> docker-compose.yml
   122→            echo "    restart: always" >> docker-compose.yml
   123→            echo "    env_file:" >> docker-compose.yml
   124→            echo "      - .env.frontend" >> docker-compose.yml
   125→
   126→            $DOCKER_COMPOSE up -d
   127→

1→from contextlib import asynccontextmanager
     2→
     3→from fastapi import FastAPI
     4→from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
     5→import uvicorn
     6→
     7→from src.core.config import Config
     8→from src.lib.manager import ConnectionManager
     9→from src.router.path_router import router
    10→from src.utils.logger import intercept_standard_logging, logger
    11→from storage.db_manager import DatabaseManager
    12→
    13→intercept_standard_logging()
    14→
    15→
    16→@asynccontextmanager
    17→async def lifespan(app: FastAPI):
    18→    logger.info("Starting application initialization")
    19→
    20→    manager = ConnectionManager()
    21→    db_manager = DatabaseManager()
    22→
    23→    try:
    24→        logger.info("Cleaning up existing Daily.co rooms before initialization")
    25→        await manager.cleanup_daily_rooms()
    26→    except Exception as e:
    27→        logger.error(f"Failed to clean up existing Daily.co rooms: {e}")
    28→        logger.warning("Continuing without initial room cleanup")
    29→
    30→    app.state.manager = manager
    31→    app.state.db_manager = db_manager
    32→
    33→    logger.info("Application initialized successfully")
    34→    yield
    35→
    36→    logger.info("Application shutting down, cleaning up resources...")
    37→
    38→    try:
    39→        await manager.cleanup()
    40→        db_manager.close()
    41→        logger.info("All connections and resources terminated")
    42→    except Exception as e:
    43→        logger.error(f"Error during application shutdown cleanup: {e}")
    44→        logger.error("Some resources may not have been properly cleaned up")
    45→
    46→
    47→app = FastAPI(title="Flow AI", version="1.0.2", lifespan=lifespan)
    48→
    49→app.add_middleware(
    50→    CORSMiddleware,
    51→    allow_origins=Config.CORS_ORIGINS,
    52→    allow_credentials=True,
    53→    allow_methods=["*"],
    54→    allow_headers=["*"],
    55→)
    56→
    57→
    58→@app.get("/health")

    62→
    63→app.include_router(router)

    65→if __name__ == "__main__":

1→from contextlib import asynccontextmanager
     2→from typing import Any, Dict
     3→
     4→from fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException
     5→from fastapi.middleware.cors import CORSMiddleware
     6→from loguru import logger
     7→from supabase import Client, create_client
     8→import uvicorn
     9→
    10→from src.core.config import Config
    11→from src.lib.manager import ConnectionManager
    12→from src.router.analytics_router import router as analytics_router
    13→from src.router.candidate_router import router as candidate_router
    14→from src.router.interview_router import router as interview_router
    15→from src.router.invites_router import router as invites_router
    16→from src.router.linkedin_oauth_router import router as linkedin_oauth_router
    17→from src.router.organization_router import router as organization_router
    18→from src.router.phone_screen_router import router as phone_screen_router
    19→from src.router.recording_router import router as recording_router
    20→from src.router.round_router import router as round_router
    21→from src.router.user_router import router as user_router
    22→from src.utils.logger import intercept_standard_logging
    23→from src.services.phone_screen_scheduler import PhoneScreenScheduler
    24→
    25→import asyncio
    26→
    27→intercept_standard_logging()
    28→
    29→# Initialize Supabase client
    30→supabase: Client = None
    31→
    32→
    33→@asynccontextmanager
    34→async def lifespan(app: FastAPI):
    35→    global supabase
    36→    logger.info("Starting application initialization")
    37→
    38→    try:
    39→        # Initialize Supabase client
    40→        supabase = create_client(Config.SUPABASE_URL, Config.SUPABASE_KEY)
    41→        logger.info("Supabase client initialized successfully")
    42→
    43→        # Initialize ConnectionManager
    44→        manager = ConnectionManager()
    45→
    46→        # Clean up existing Daily.co rooms if enabled
    47→        if Config.DAILY_CLEANUP_ON_STARTUP:
    48→            try:
    49→                logger.info("Cleaning up existing Daily.co rooms before initialization")
    50→                await manager.cleanup_daily_rooms()
    51→            except Exception as e:
    52→                logger.error(f"Failed to clean up existing Daily.co rooms: {e}")
    53→                logger.warning("Continuing without initial room cleanup")
    54→
    55→        app.state.manager = manager
    56→
    57→        # Start Phone Screen Scheduler automatically
    58→        try:
    59→            
    60→            
    61→            logger.info("Starting phone screen scheduler...")
    62→            scheduler = PhoneScreenScheduler(check_interval_minutes=60)  # Check every 1 hour
    63→            scheduler_task = asyncio.create_task(scheduler.start())
    64→            app.state.scheduler_task = scheduler_task
    65→            app.state.scheduler = scheduler
    66→            logger.info("Phone screen scheduler started successfully")
    67→        except Exception as e:
    68→            logger.error(f"Failed to start phone screen scheduler: {e}")
    69→            logger.warning("Continuing without phone screen scheduler")
    70→
    71→    except Exception as e:
    72→        logger.error(f"Failed to initialize application: {e}")
    73→        raise
    74→
    75→    app.state.supabase = supabase
    76→    logger.info("Application initialized successfully")
    77→    yield
    78→
    79→    logger.info("Application shutting down...")
    80→    
    81→    # Stop phone screen scheduler
    82→    try:
    83→        if hasattr(app.state, "scheduler") and hasattr(app.state, "scheduler_task"):
    84→            logger.info("Stopping phone screen scheduler...")
    85→            await app.state.scheduler.stop()
    86→            app.state.scheduler_task.cancel()
    87→            try:
    88→                await app.state.scheduler_task
    89→            except asyncio.CancelledError:
    90→                pass
    91→            logger.info("Phone screen scheduler stopped successfully")
    92→    except Exception as e:
    93→        logger.error(f"Error stopping phone screen scheduler: {e}")
    94→    
    95→    # Cleanup ConnectionManager
    96→    try:
    97→        if hasattr(app.state, "manager"):
    98→            await app.state.manager.cleanup()
    99→            logger.info("ConnectionManager cleaned up successfully")
   100→    except Exception as e:
   101→        logger.error(f"Error during ConnectionManager cleanup: {e}")
   102→
   103→    logger.info("All resources terminated")
   104→
   105→
   106→app = FastAPI(title="Flowterview Backend", version="1.0.0", lifespan=lifespan)
   107→
   108→logger.info(f"CORS origins: {Config.CORS_ORIGINS}")
   109→
   110→# CORS middleware
   111→app.add_middleware(
   112→    CORSMiddleware,
   113→    allow_origins=Config.CORS_ORIGINS,
   114→    allow_credentials=True,
   115→    allow_methods=["*"],
   116→    allow_headers=["*"],
   117→)
   118→
   119→# Include routers
   120→app.include_router(interview_router)
   121→app.include_router(organization_router)
   122→app.include_router(user_router)
   123→app.include_router(candidate_router)
   124→app.include_router(invites_router)
   125→app.include_router(linkedin_oauth_router)
   126→app.include_router(analytics_router)
   127→app.include_router(phone_screen_router)
   128→app.include_router(recording_router)
   129→app.include_router(round_router)
   130→
   131→
   132→@app.get("/health")
   133→async def health_check() -> Dict[str, Any]:
   134→    """Health check endpoint"""
   135→    return {
   136→        "status": "healthy",
   137→        "version": "1.0.2",
   138→        "supabase_connected": supabase is not None,
   139→        "manager_initialized": (hasattr(app.state, "manager") if hasattr(app, "state") else False),
   140→    }
   141→
   142→
   143→@app.post("/loopback")
   144→async def loopback(data: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
   145→    """
   146→    Loopback endpoint that echoes back the received data
   147→    Useful for testing and debugging
   148→    """
   149→    try:
   150→        # Log the received data
   151→        logger.info(f"Received data in loopback: {data}")
   152→
   153→        # Echo back the data with a timestamp
   154→        return {
   155→            "status": "success",
   156→            "message": "Data received successfully",
   157→            "data": data,
   158→            "timestamp": str(logger.now()),
   159→        }
   160→    except Exception as e:
   161→        logger.error(f"Error in loopback endpoint: {e}")
   162→        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=str(e))
   163→
   164→
   165→if __name__ == "__main__":
   166→    logger.info(f"Starting application server in {Config.ENVIRONMENT} mode")
   167→    uvicorn.run(
   168→        "main:app",
   169→        host=Config.HOST,
   170→        port=Config.PORT,
   171→        reload=Config.RELOAD,
   172→        proxy_headers=True,
   173→        forwarded_allow_ips="*",
   174→        reload_excludes=[
   175→            ".venv",
   176→            ".venv/*",
   177→            "venv",
   178→            "venv/*",
   179→            "env",
   180→            "env/*",
   181→            "__pycache__",
   182→            "__pycache__/*",
   183→            "*.pyc",
   184→            "*.pyo",
   185→            "*.pyd",
   186→            ".git",
   187→            ".git/*",
   188→            "node_modules",
   189→            "node_modules/*",
   190→            ".pytest_cache",
   191→            ".pytest_cache/*",
   192→            "*.log",
   193→            "*.sqlite",
   194→            "*.db",
   195→            ".DS_Store",
   196→            "Thumbs.db",
   197→            "*.tmp",
   198→            "*.temp",
   199→            ".coverage",
   200→            "htmlcov",
   201→            "htmlcov/*",
   202→            "dist",
   203→            "dist/*",
   204→            "build",
   205→            "build/*",
   206→            "*.egg-info",
   207→            "*.egg-info/*",
   208→        ],
   209→        reload_dirs=["src", "storage"],  # Only watch specific directories
   210→    )

1→# syntax=docker.io/docker/dockerfile:1
     2→
     3→FROM node:20-alpine AS base
     4→
     5→# Install dependencies only when needed
     6→FROM base AS deps
     7→# Check https://github.com/nodejs/docker-node/tree/b4117f9333da4138b03a546ec926ef50a31506c3#nodealpine to understand why libc6-compat might be needed.
     8→RUN apk add --no-cache libc6-compat
     9→WORKDIR /app
    10→
    11→# Install dependencies based on the preferred package manager
    12→COPY package.json yarn.lock* package-lock.json* pnpm-lock.yaml* .npmrc* ./
    13→RUN \
    14→  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn --frozen-lockfile; \
    15→  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm ci; \
    16→  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm i --frozen-lockfile; \
    17→  else echo "Lockfile not found." && exit 1; \
    18→  fi
    19→
    20→
    21→# Rebuild the source code only when needed
    22→FROM base AS builder
    23→WORKDIR /app
    24→COPY --from=deps /app/node_modules ./node_modules
    25→COPY . .
    26→
    27→# Accept environment variables as build-time args
    28→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL
    29→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
    30→ARG DATABASE_URL
    31→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL
    32→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL
    33→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL
    34→ARG NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL
    35→
    36→# Export them for Next.js to use during build
    37→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL
    38→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=$NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
    39→ENV DATABASE_URL=$DATABASE_URL
    40→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL
    41→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL
    42→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL
    43→ENV NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL=$NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL
    44→
    45→RUN \
    46→  if [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn run build; \
    47→  elif [ -f package-lock.json ]; then npm run build; \
    48→  elif [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then corepack enable pnpm && pnpm run build; \
    49→  else echo "Lockfile not found." && exit 1; \
    50→  fi
    51→
    52→# Production image, copy all the files and run next
    53→FROM base AS runner
    54→WORKDIR /app
    55→
    56→ENV NODE_ENV=production
    57→# Uncomment the following line in case you want to disable telemetry during runtime.
    58→# ENV NEXT_TELEMETRY_DISABLED=1
    59→
    60→RUN addgroup --system --gid 1001 nodejs
    61→RUN adduser --system --uid 1001 nextjs
    62→
    63→COPY --from=builder /app/public ./public
    64→
    65→# Automatically leverage output traces to reduce image size
    66→# https://nextjs.org/docs/advanced-features/output-file-tracing
    67→COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/standalone ./
    68→COPY --from=builder --chown=nextjs:nodejs /app/.next/static ./.next/static
    69→
    70→USER nextjs
    71→
    72→# server.js is created by next build from the standalone output
    73→# https://nextjs.org/docs/pages/api-reference/config/next-config-js/output
    74→ENV HOSTNAME="0.0.0.0"
    75→CMD ["node", "server.js"]

1→from datetime import datetime
     2→import json
     3→import os
     4→import subprocess
     5→import uuid
     6→
     7→from fastapi import APIRouter, Body, HTTPException, Request
     8→
     9→from src.core.config import Config
    10→from src.llm_handler.flow_generator import generate_interview_flow_from_jd
    11→from src.utils.logger import logger
    12→
    13→UPLOAD_DIR = Config.UPLOAD_DIR
    14→
    15→router = APIRouter(
    16→    prefix="/api/v1",
    17→    tags=["Path"],
    18→    responses={404: {"description": "Not found"}},
    19→)
    20→
    21→
    22→@router.post("/connect")
    23→async def rtvi_connect(request: Request):
    24→    manager = request.app.state.manager
    25→
    26→    room_url, bot_token = await manager.create_room_and_token()
    27→    session_id = str(uuid.uuid4())
    28→
    29→    body = await request.json()
    30→    job_id = body.get("job_id", None)
    31→    candidate_id = body.get("candidate_id", None)
    32→    linkedin_profile = body.get("linkedin_profile", None)
    33→    additional_links = body.get("additional_links", None)
    34→
    35→    try:
    36→        # Build the command list first
    37→        command = [
    38→            "python3",
    39→            "-m",
    40→            "src.services.bot_defaults",
    41→            "-u",
    42→            room_url,
    43→            "-t",
    44→            bot_token,
    45→            "-s",
    46→            session_id,
    47→        ]
    48→
    49→        if job_id:
    50→            command.extend(["-j", job_id])
    51→        if candidate_id:
    52→            command.extend(["-c", candidate_id])
    53→        if linkedin_profile:
    54→            command.extend(["-l", linkedin_profile])
    55→        if additional_links:
    56→            command.extend(["-a", json.dumps(additional_links)])
    57→
    58→        proc = subprocess.Popen(
    59→            command,
    60→            bufsize=1,
    61→            cwd=os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)))),
    62→        )
    63→
    64→        manager.add_process(proc.pid, proc)
    65→    except Exception as e:
    66→        logger.error(f"Error starting bot process: {e}")
    67→        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail="Failed to process!")
    68→
    69→    return {"room_url": room_url, "token": bot_token}
    70→
    71→
    72→@router.post("/disconnect")
    73→async def rtvi_disconnect(token: str, request: Request):
    74→    """Disconnect the voice chat session and cleanup resources."""
    75→    manager = request.app.state.manager
    76→    try:
    77→        # Since there's no DB, we can't check for room URL by token anymore
    78→        # We'll just clean up processes
    79→
    80→        for pid, proc in manager.processes.items():
    81→            try:
    82→                proc.terminate()
    83→                proc.wait()
    84→                logger.info(f"Process {pid} terminated successfully")
    85→            except Exception as e:
    86→                logger.error(f"Error terminating process {pid}: {e}")
    87→
    88→        return {"message": "Disconnected successfully"}
    89→
    90→    except Exception as e:
    91→        logger.error(f"Error during disconnect: {e}")
    92→        raise HTTPException(status_code=500, detail=f"Disconnect failed: {str(e)}")
    93→
    94→
    95→@router.get("/hellos")
    96→async def hellos(request: Request):
    97→    return {"message": "Hello, world!"}
    98→
    99→
   100→@router.post("/generate_interview_flow_from_description")

     7→
     8→class Environment(str, Enum):

    10→    PRODUCTION = "production"
    11→
    12→
    13→env = os.getenv("ENV", "development")
    14→if env == "production":

    16→else:

   163→                Punctuation serves many purposes in normal writing, it indicates sentence structural things like sentence breaks and questions, but it also serves to indicate pronunciation cues, such as commas for pauses and exclamation points for excitement.

   206→                    2) Zero point seven five	(0 point 7 5)

   217→                    2) Seventy degrees Fahrenheit	(70°F)
   218→

   222→                    2) March fifteenth, twenty twenty-three	(March 15, 2023)

   224→                    4) January first	(Jan. 1)
   225→
   226→                    Times

   229→                    2) Ten thirty A M	(10:30am)
   230→                    3) Ten thirty A M	(10:30 AM)
   231→                    4) Two o’clock P M	(2 o’clock p. m.)
   232→
   233→                Abbreviations, Acronyms, and Initialisms

   238→                    4) Saint John	(St. John)
   239→
   240→                    Acronyms and Initialisms
   241→                    Acronyms are pronounced as a single word, for example, NASA is pronounced as “Nasa”. Initialisms are pronounced as a series of letters, for example DNA is pronounced as “D N A”.
   242→                    By default Rime will pronounce a series of capital letters as acronyms, i.e. as a single word. However, for many common initialisms, e.g. DNA, ID, USA, FBI, CIA, etc., Rime will automatically pronounce them correctly as a series of letters.
   243→                    That being said, to ensure that initialisms are pronounced correctly as a series of letters, the best practice is to use lower case and put a period and space after each letter.
   244→                    Desired Output	(Input)
   245→                    1) Nasa	(NASA)

   248→                    4) UPS	(u. p. s.)

   261→                    While Rime will typically pronounce state name abbreviations correctly in the context of an address, best practice is to write out the full state name, e.g. “Massachusetts” instead of “MA”, to get consistent results. Common street abbreviations, e.g. “Rd.” or “St.”, will automatically be pronounced correctly.

   272→
   273→                Emails

   275→                    1) Name at example dot com	(name@example.com)
   276→            """

    44→async def create_candidate_interview(candidate_id: str, interview_id: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    45→    """Create a single room and token for a candidate"""
    46→    try:
    47→        # First check if candidate_interview already exists
    48→        existing_candidate_interview = db.fetch_one(
    49→            "candidate_interviews",
    50→            {"interview_id": interview_id, "candidate_id": candidate_id},
    51→        )
    52→
    53→        if existing_candidate_interview:
    54→            logger.info(f"Candidate interview already exists for candidate {candidate_id} in interview {interview_id}")
    55→            return {
    56→                "success": True,
    57→                "candidate_id": candidate_id,
    58→                "candidate_interview_id": existing_candidate_interview["id"],
    59→                "already_existed": True,
    60→            }
    61→
    62→        # Store in candidate_interviews table
    63→        candidate_interview_data = {
    64→            "id": str(uuid.uuid4()),
    65→            "interview_id": interview_id,
    66→            "candidate_id": candidate_id,
    67→            "status": "Scheduled",
    68→            "created_at": datetime.now().isoformat(),
    69→            "updated_at": datetime.now().isoformat(),
    70→        }
    71→
    72→        # Insert into database
    73→        db.execute_query("candidate_interviews", candidate_interview_data)
    74→
    75→        logger.info(f"Created candidate_interview for candidate {candidate_id}")
    76→

    80→            "candidate_interview_id": candidate_interview_data["id"],

Perfect! Now I have all the information needed. Let me create a comprehensive summary of the Sivera project architecture.

## COMPREHENSIVE SIVERA PROJECT ARCHITECTURE ANALYSIS

I've completed a thorough exploration of the Sivera AI-powered interview platform. Here's the complete architectural overview:

---

## 1. TOP-LEVEL DIRECTORIES & STRUCTURE

```
/Users/kannetinagaadithya/Documents/Sivera/
├── frontend/                   # Candidate interview application (Next.js)
├── flowterview-app/            # Recruiter dashboard (Next.js)
├── backend/                    # Interview voice agent backend (FastAPI)
├── flowterview-backend/        # Recruiter API backend (FastAPI)
├── docker-compose.candidate.yml
├── docker-compose.recruiter.yml
├── .github/workflows/          # CI/CD pipelines
├── README.md                   # Main project documentation
└── .pre-commit-config.yaml     # Pre-commit hooks
```

---

## 2. FOUR CORE SERVICES & PURPOSE

### A. **Candidate App** (`frontend/`)
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 + React 19
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Package Manager**: pnpm
- **Port**: 3000 (dev) / 3001 (prod)
- **Purpose**: Interactive AI voice interview interface for candidates
- **Key Endpoints**: 
  - `/interview` - Token verification, registration, permissions
  - `/round` - Multi-round interview selection
  - `/components/flowterview/` - Core interview orchestration (audio, code editor, screen recording)
- **Key Dependencies**:
  - `@pipecat-ai/client-js` + `@pipecat-ai/daily-transport` - Voice/WebSocket connection
  - `@monaco-editor/react` - In-browser code editor
  - `zustand` - State management
  - `framer-motion` - Animations
  - Supabase auth

### B. **Recruiter Dashboard** (`flowterview-app/`)
- **Framework**: Next.js 15.3.1 + React 19
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Package Manager**: pnpm
- **Port**: 3001 (dev) / 3000 (prod, runs alongside backend on single instance)
- **Purpose**: Recruiter interface for managing interviews, candidates, and analytics
- **Key Pages**:
  - `/auth/` - Login, signup, OAuth callbacks
  - `/dashboard/` - Overview with stats
  - `/dashboard/interviews/` - Interview CRUD & visual flow builder
  - `/dashboard/candidates/` - Candidate management & bulk invite
  - `/dashboard/analytics/` - Charts, completion rates, scores
  - `/dashboard/settings/` - Organization configuration
- **Key Dependencies**:
  - `@supabase/ssr` + `@supabase/auth-helpers-nextjs` - Auth & DB access
  - `@tanstack/react-query` - Server state & caching
  - `reactflow` - Visual interview flow builder
  - `recharts` - Data visualization
  - `framer-motion` - Animations
  - Zod for validation

### C. **Interview Backend** (`backend/`)
- **Framework**: FastAPI 0.115.8+
- **Language**: Python 3.12+
- **Package Manager**: uv (fast Python package manager)
- **Port**: 8000
- **Purpose**: Real-time AI voice interview orchestration powered by Pipecat
- **Key Architecture**:
  - **WebSocket Connection**: `/api/v1/connect` - Creates Daily.co room + bot token
  - **Bot Orchestration**: Launches subprocess running `bot_defaults.py` (Pipecat agent)
  - **Process Management**: Manages bot subprocess lifecycle
- **Key Components** (`src/`):
  - `router/path_router.py` - WebSocket & bot connection endpoints
  - `services/bot_defaults.py` - Bot configuration, LLM integration, flow execution
  - `services/interview_flow.py` - Interview flow management
  - `services/handler_functions.py` - AI response evaluation & next step logic
  - `services/llm_factory.py` - Multi-LLM provider abstraction
  - `services/tts_factory.py` - Text-to-speech provider selection
  - `lib/manager.py` - Daily.co room & token management
  - `constants/ai_models.py` - Supported LLM models
- **Dependencies**:
  - `pipecat-ai[silero,daily,elevenlabs,google,deepgram,openai,anthropic,websocket,cartesia,groq,aws]` - Voice agent framework
  - `google-generativeai` - Gemini API
  - `openai` - GPT-4 / GPT-4o
  - Groq SDK - Low-latency inference
  - Anthropic Claude SDK
  - Supabase SDK
  - Daily.co API integration

### D. **Recruiter API Backend** (`flowterview-backend/`)
- **Framework**: FastAPI 0.115.8+
- **Language**: Python 3.12
- **Package Manager**: uv
- **Port**: 8010
- **Purpose**: REST API for recruiter platform - CRUD, auth, scheduling, analytics, email
- **Key Routers** (`src/router/`):
  - `interview_router.py` - Interview CRUD, flow generation from JD via LLM
  - `candidate_router.py` - Candidate management
  - `invites_router.py` - Bulk invitation creation & email sending
  - `analytics_router.py` - Performance metrics & scoring
  - `recording_router.py` - Video recording retrieval (S3/CloudFront)
  - `phone_screen_router.py` - Human phone interview scheduling
  - `organization_router.py` - Multi-tenant org management
  - `user_router.py` - User management & RBAC
  - `linkedin_oauth_router.py` - LinkedIn OAuth integration
  - `round_router.py` - Multi-round interview configuration
- **Key Features**:
  - Supabase PostgreSQL for data persistence
  - Email via Loops.so (SMTP)
  - AWS S3 + CloudFront for recording storage & CDN
  - Phone screen scheduler (checks every 60 minutes)
  - LinkedIn OAuth for candidate profile import
  - LLM-based interview flow generation from job descriptions
- **Dependencies**:
  - `supabase>=1.0.3` - Database & auth
  - `pipecat-ai` - For phone screening bot
  - `boto3` - AWS S3 integration
  - `aiosmtplib` - Async email sending

---

## 3. COMPLETE TECH STACK

### Frontend Technologies
| Technology | Purpose | Version |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| Next.js | React framework with App Router | 15.1.7 / 15.3.1 |
| React | UI library | 19.0.0 |
| TypeScript | Type safety | 5 |
| Tailwind CSS | Utility-first styling | 3.4.1 / 4 |
| Radix UI + Shadcn/UI | Accessible component library | Latest |
| Zustand | Client state management | 5.0.3 |
| TanStack React Query | Server state & caching | 5.84.1 |
| Framer Motion | Animations | 12.4.7 / 12.7.4 |
| Recharts | Data visualization | 2.15.3 |
| Monaco Editor | In-browser code editor | 0.52.2 |
| React Flow | Visual flow builder | 11.11.4+ |
| Pipecat Client | Real-time voice/video client | 1.0.0 |
| Daily.co JS SDK | WebRTC infrastructure | Latest |
| Supabase Auth Helpers | Auth integration | 0.10.0 / 0.5.0 |

### Backend Technologies
| Technology | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| FastAPI 0.115.8+ | Async Python web framework |
| Supabase | PostgreSQL database, auth, real-time |
| Pipecat AI 0.0.80+ | Voice agent orchestration framework |
| Daily.co | WebRTC rooms for voice/video |
| uvicorn | ASGI server |
| loguru | Structured logging |

### AI & Voice Services
| Service | Capability | Status |
|---------|-----------|--------|
| **LLM Providers** | | |
| Google Gemini 2.0 Flash | Primary LLM for interviews | Primary |
| OpenAI GPT-4 / GPT-4o | Alternative LLM | Supported |
| Groq | Low-latency inference | Supported |
| Anthropic Claude | Alternative LLM | Supported |
| **STT (Speech-to-Text)** | | |
| Deepgram | Primary STT | Supported |
| Google Cloud Speech | Alternative STT | Supported |
| Silero | Local/fallback STT | Supported |
| **TTS (Text-to-Speech)** | | |
| ElevenLabs | Primary TTS | Supported |
| Cartesia | Premium TTS | Supported |
| Google Cloud Text-to-Speech | Alternative TTS | Supported |
| AWS Polly | Alternative TTS | Supported |
| Rime | Alternative TTS | Supported |
| **Real-time Communication** | | |
| Daily.co | WebRTC rooms | Primary |

### Infrastructure & DevOps
| Technology | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| Docker | Containerization |
| Docker Compose | Local/dev orchestration |
| GitHub Actions | CI/CD pipelines |
| AWS EC2 | Compute hosting |
| AWS S3 + CloudFront | Recording storage & CDN |
| Vercel | Optional frontend hosting |
| Loops.so | Transactional email (SMTP) |

---

## 4. SERVICE COMMUNICATION ARCHITECTURE

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                        RECRUITER FLOW                            │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                   │
│   Recruiter Dashboard (flowterview-app:3001)                     │
│          │                                                        │
│          │ REST API calls                                        │
│          ▼                                                        │
│   Recruiter API Backend (flowterview-backend:8010)               │
│     ├─ Interview CRUD, flow generation                          │
│     ├─ Candidate management                                      │
│     ├─ Email invitations (Loops.so SMTP)                        │
│     ├─ Recording management (AWS S3)                            │
│     ├─ Phone screen scheduling                                  │
│     ├─ Analytics & scoring                                      │
│     └─ LinkedIn OAuth integration                               │
│          │                                                        │
│          └──────┬──────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │
│                 │                                              │ │
│          ┌──────▼──────┐                              ┌────────▼─┤
│          │  Supabase   │◄────────────────────────────┤ DB/Auth  │
│          │ PostgreSQL  │                              └──────────┤
│          └─────────────┘                                         │
│                                                                   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                        CANDIDATE FLOW                            │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                   │
│   Email Invitation ──────────────────────────────────┐          │
│     (from Loops.so)                                   │          │
│                                                        ▼          │
│   Candidate App (frontend:3000)                    Token Link     │
│     ├─ Token verification                                        │
│     ├─ Registration & permissions                               │
│     ├─ Voice interview UI                                       │
│     └─ Code editor + Screen recording                           │
│          │                                                        │
│          │ WebSocket + Daily.co                                  │
│          ▼                                                        │
│   Interview Backend (backend:8000)                              │
│     ├─ POST /api/v1/connect                                    │
│     │    ├─ Creates Daily.co room & token                      │
│     │    ├─ Spawns bot subprocess (bot_defaults.py)            │
│     │    └─ Returns room_url + bot_token                       │
│     │                                                            │
│     └─ Pipecat Bot (subprocess)                                │
│          ├─ Real-time voice interaction via Daily.co           │
│          ├─ STT: Deepgram (speech-to-text)                    │
│          ├─ LLM: Gemini/GPT-4/Groq (understanding)             │
│          ├─ TTS: ElevenLabs/Cartesia (voice output)            │
│          ├─ Interview flow execution                            │
│          ├─ Response evaluation                                 │
│          └─ Transcript generation                              │
│                                                                   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│           INTER-SERVICE COMMUNICATION PATTERNS                   │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                   │
│ • Recruiter Dashboard → Recruiter API: REST (fetch/POST/PUT)    │
│ • Recruiter API → Supabase: SDK calls (CRUD)                    │
│ • Recruiter API → Loops: SMTP email send                        │
│ • Recruiter API → AWS S3: boto3 recording upload/retrieval      │
│ • Frontend → Interview Backend: WebSocket (Daily.co)            │
│ • Interview Backend → Supabase: SDK calls (read interview data)│
│ • Pipecat Bot → LLM APIs: HTTP/gRPC (Gemini, OpenAI, Groq)    │
│ • Pipecat Bot → STT/TTS: HTTP (Deepgram, ElevenLabs)           │
│ • Phone Scheduler → External Calendar API: Scheduling          │
│                                                                   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Key Communication Patterns:

1. **Candidate Interview Session**:
   - Frontend connects to `backend:8000/api/v1/connect` via HTTP
   - Backend creates Daily.co room and spawns Python subprocess running bot
   - Frontend opens WebSocket to Daily.co room
   - Pipecat bot uses WebSocket to communicate with candidate in real-time
   - Bot processes speech via Deepgram (STT) → LLM → TTS → Audio output

2. **Recruiter Operations**:
   - Dashboard calls Recruiter API (`flowterview-backend:8010`) via REST
   - API persists data to Supabase PostgreSQL
   - API sends emails via Loops.so SMTP
   - API manages recordings via AWS S3

3. **Data Flow**:
   - Interview configuration stored in Supabase
   - Candidate responses stored in Supabase via Interview Backend
   - Recordings uploaded to S3, served via CloudFront
   - Transcripts and evaluations stored in Supabase

---

## 5. INFRASTRUCTURE & DEPLOYMENT

### Docker Composition

**Candidate Services** (`docker-compose.candidate.yml`):
```yaml
services:
  backend:
    image: sivera/sivera:backend
    ports: ["8000:8000"]
    env_file: .env.candidate
    restart: always
    
  frontend:
    image: sivera/sivera:frontend
    ports: ["3000:3000"]
    env_file: .env.candidate
    restart: always
```

**Recruiter Services** (`docker-compose.recruiter.yml`):
```yaml
services:
  flowterview-backend:
    image: sivera/sivera:recruiter-backend
    ports: ["8010:8010"]
    env_file: .env.recruiter
    restart: always
    
  flowterview-app:
    image: sivera/sivera:recruiter-frontend
    ports: ["3000:3000"]
    env_file: .env.recruiter
    restart: always
```

### CI/CD Pipelines (GitHub Actions)

**1. Main App Deploy** (`.github/workflows/main-app-deploy.yml`)
- **Triggers**: Push to main/master on changes to `backend/`, `frontend/`, or workflow file
- **Build**:
  - Builds Docker images: `sivera/sivera:backend` & `sivera/sivera:frontend`
  - Uses Docker Buildx for caching
  - Pushes to Docker Hub
- **Deploy**:
  - SSH to AWS EC2 instance (`AWS_MAIN_APP_HOST`)
  - Pulls images from Docker Hub
  - Creates `.env.backend` & `.env.frontend` from secrets
  - Runs `docker-compose up -d`
  - Endpoints: `app.sivera.io:3001` (frontend), `core.sivera.io:8000` (backend)

**2. Recruiter App Deploy** (`.github/workflows/recruiter-app-deploy.yml`)
- **Triggers**: Push to main/master on changes to `flowterview-backend/`, `flowterview-app/`, or workflow file
- **Build**:
  - Builds: `sivera/sivera:recruiter-backend` & `sivera/sivera:recruiter-frontend`
  - Docker Buildx with caching
- **Deploy**:
  - SSH to different AWS EC2 instance (`AWS_RECRUITER_APP_HOST`)
  - Pulls images, generates env files
  - Runs `docker-compose up -d`
  - Endpoints: `recruiter.sivera.io:3000` (frontend), `api.sivera.io:8010` (backend)

### Production URLs

| Service | URL | Port | Purpose |
|---------|-----|------|---------|
| Candidate App | app.sivera.io | 3001 | Interview interface |
| Recruiter Dashboard | recruiter.sivera.io | 3000 | Recruiter portal |
| Interview Backend | core.sivera.io | 8000 | Voice AI orchestration |
| Recruiter API | api.sivera.io | 8010 | REST API |

### Build Process

**Frontend Dockerfile** (Multi-stage Next.js):
- Base: `node:20-alpine`
- Stage 1: Install dependencies (pnpm)
- Stage 2: Build Next.js app with build-time env vars
- Stage 3: Production runner with standalone output
- Output: Optimized image, ~100MB

**Backend Dockerfile** (Python FastAPI):
- Base: `python:3.13-slim` (candidate) / `python:3.12-slim` (recruiter)
- Install system deps, uv package manager
- Copy `pyproject.toml`, `uv.lock`, source code
- Run `uv sync` for dependencies
- Expose ports 8000 (candidate) / 8010 (recruiter)
- Run with `uv run main.py`

---

## 6. ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES & CONFIGURATION

### Frontend Apps (`.env` required)
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL=          # Supabase project URL
NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY=     # Supabase anonymous key
DATABASE_URL=                       # PostgreSQL connection (for Drizzle)
NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL=              # Frontend public URL
NEXT_PUBLIC_SIVERA_BACKEND_URL=    # Recruiter API endpoint
NEXT_PUBLIC_CORE_BACKEND_URL=      # Interview backend endpoint
NEXT_PUBLIC_PIPECAT_BASE_URL=      # Pipecat base URL (candidate only)
```

### Interview Backend (`.env.backend` or `.env`)
```
# LLM & AI Services
OPENAI_API_KEY=                    # GPT-4 API
GEMINI_API_KEY=                    # Google Gemini
GROQ_API_KEY=                      # Groq inference
ELEVENLABS_API_KEY=                # Text-to-speech
DEEPGRAM_API_KEY=                  # Speech-to-text
CARTESIA_API_KEY=                  # Premium TTS

# Infrastructure
DAILY_API_KEY=                     # Daily.co video rooms
SUPABASE_URL=                      # Database
SUPABASE_KEY=                      # DB service key

# Email
SMTP_HOST=                         # Loops.so SMTP
SMTP_PORT=
SMTP_USER=
SMTP_PASS=

# Configuration
ENV=production|development
PORT=8000
RELOAD=false
TTS_PROVIDER=elevenlabs            # Options: elevenlabs, cartesia, google, aws_polly, rime
LLM_PROVIDER=openai                # Options: openai, google, groq, anthropic
LLM_MODEL=gpt-4                    # Specific model to use
```

### Recruiter Backend (`.env.backend`)
```
# Supabase
SUPABASE_URL=
SUPABASE_KEY=

# Email (Loops.so)
SMTP_HOST=smtp.loops.so
SMTP_PORT=587
SMTP_USER=loops
SMTP_PASS=                         # Loops API key
LOOPS_*_TEMPLATE=                  # Various email template IDs

# AWS (for recordings)
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=
AWS_REGION=us-east-1

# LLM (for flow generation)
OPENAI_API_KEY=
GEMINI_API_KEY=
GROQ_API_KEY=

# Voice Services

ELEVENLABS_API_KEY=

```

---

## 7. KEY ARCHITECTURAL DECISIONS

1. **Microservices Architecture**: 4 independent services (2 frontend, 2 backend) enabling independent scaling and deployment
2. **WebSocket for Real-time**: Direct WebSocket to Daily.co for low-latency voice communication
3. **Subprocess Bot Model**: Interview backend spawns independent Python subprocess for each interview (process isolation)
4. **Multi-LLM Support**: Abstract factory pattern allows switching between Gemini, GPT-4, Groq, Claude
5. **Supabase for Everything**: Single source of truth for auth, database, real-time features
6. **Pipecat Framework**: Decouples voice orchestration from interview logic
7. **AWS S3/CloudFront**: Scalable recording storage with CDN delivery
8. **Docker Compose for Local Dev**: Easy setup with all services in docker-compose files
9. **GitHub Actions CI/CD**: Automated Docker builds and EC2 deployments
10. **Flexible TTS/STT**: Pluggable providers (ElevenLabs, Cartesia, Google, AWS Polly, Rime, Deepgram)

---

## 8. FILE ORGANIZATION REFERENCE

**Interview Backend Structure**:
- `main.py` - FastAPI app with Pipecat connection
- `src/router/path_router.py` - WebSocket endpoints
- `src/services/bot_defaults.py` - Bot agent configuration
- `src/services/interview_flow.py` - Interview step management
- `src/services/handler_functions.py` - Response evaluation
- `src/services/llm_factory.py` - LLM provider selection
- `src/lib/manager.py` - Daily.co room management
- `storage/db_manager.py` - SQLite/DB interactions

**Recruiter Backend Structure**:
- `main.py` - FastAPI app with Supabase client
- `src/router/interview_router.py` - Interview CRUD + email
- `src/router/candidate_router.py` - Candidate management
- `src/router/invites_router.py` - Bulk invitations
- `src/router/analytics_router.py` - Performance metrics
- `src/router/phone_screen_router.py` - Scheduling
- `src/router/recording_router.py` - Video retrieval
- `src/services/phone_screen_scheduler.py` - Async scheduler

**Candidate App Structure**:
- `app/interview/page.tsx` - Interview entry & token verification
- `app/round/page.tsx` - Round selection
- `app/components/flowterview/main-component.tsx` - Core orchestrator
- `app/components/flowterview/audio-client.tsx` - Voice handler
- `app/components/flowterview/CodingEditor.tsx` - Monaco editor
- `app/components/flowterview/screen-recorder-optimized.tsx` - Recording

**Recruiter Dashboard Structure**:
- `src/app/auth/` - Auth pages (login, signup, OAuth)
- `src/app/dashboard/interviews/` - Interview CRUD & builder
- `src/app/dashboard/candidates/` - Candidate management
- `src/app/dashboard/analytics/` - Charts & metrics
- `src/app/dashboard/settings/` - Organization config

---

This comprehensive architecture enables Sivera to conduct fully automated AI-driven technical interviews at scale while providing recruiters with powerful tools for interview design, candidate management, and performance analytics. The platform leverages cutting-edge voice AI (Pipecat), real-time communication (Daily.co), and enterprise-grade infrastructure (AWS, Supabase) to deliver a seamless hiring experience.

## COMPREHENSIVE SIVERA PROJECT ARCHITECTURE ANALYSIS

## 2. FOUR CORE SERVICES & PURPOSE

### A. **Candidate App** (`frontend/`)
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 + React 19
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Package Manager**: pnpm
- **Port**: 3000 (dev) / 3001 (prod)

### B. **Recruiter Dashboard** (`flowterview-app/`)

  - `reactflow` - Visual interview flow builder
  - `recharts` - Data visualization
  - `framer-motion` - Animations

### C. **Interview Backend** (`backend/`)
- **Framework**: FastAPI 0.115.8+
- **Language**: Python 3.12+
- **Package Manager**: uv (fast Python package manager)
- **Port**: 8000
- **Purpose**: Real-time AI voice interview orchestration powered by Pipecat
- **Key Architecture**:
  - **WebSocket Connection**: `/api/v1/connect` - Creates Daily.co room + bot token
  - **Bot Orchestration**: Launches subprocess running `bot_defaults.py` (Pipecat agent)
  - **Process Management**: Manages bot subprocess lifecycle
- **Key Components** (`src/`):
  - `router/path_router.py` - WebSocket & bot connection endpoints
  - `services/bot_defaults.py` - Bot configuration, LLM integration, flow execution
  - `services/interview_flow.py` - Interview flow management

  - `services/llm_factory.py` - Multi-LLM provider abstraction
  - `services/tts_factory.py` - Text-to-speech provider selection

- **Dependencies**:

### D. **Recruiter API Backend** (`flowterview-backend/`)
- **Framework**: FastAPI 0.115.8+
- **Language**: Python 3.12
- **Package Manager**: uv
- **Port**: 8010
- **Purpose**: REST API for recruiter platform - CRUD, auth, scheduling, analytics, email
- **Key Routers** (`src/router/`):
  - `interview_router.py` - Interview CRUD, flow generation from JD via LLM
  - `candidate_router.py` - Candidate management
  - `invites_router.py` - Bulk invitation creation & email sending
  - `analytics_router.py` - Performance metrics & scoring
  - `recording_router.py` - Video recording retrieval (S3/CloudFront)
  - `phone_screen_router.py` - Human phone interview scheduling
  - `organization_router.py` - Multi-tenant org management
  - `user_router.py` - User management & RBAC
  - `linkedin_oauth_router.py` - LinkedIn OAuth integration
  - `round_router.py` - Multi-round interview configuration
- **Key Features**:
  - Supabase PostgreSQL for data persistence
  - Email via Loops.so (SMTP)
  - AWS S3 + CloudFront for recording storage & CDN
  - Phone screen scheduler (checks every 60 minutes)
  - LinkedIn OAuth for candidate profile import
  - LLM-based interview flow generation from job descriptions
- **Dependencies**:
  - `supabase>=1.0.3` - Database & auth
  - `pipecat-ai` - For phone screening bot

## 4. SERVICE COMMUNICATION ARCHITECTURE

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                        RECRUITER FLOW                            │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                   │
│   Recruiter Dashboard (flowterview-app:3001)                     │
│          │                                                        │
│          │ REST API calls                                        │
│          ▼                                                        │

│     ├─ Interview CRUD, flow generation                          │

│          │                                                        │

│          │  Supabase   │◄────────────────────────────┤ DB/Auth  │
│          │ PostgreSQL  │                              └──────────┤
│          └─────────────┘                                         │
│                                                                   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                        CANDIDATE FLOW                            │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                   │
│   Email Invitation ──────────────────────────────────┐          │
│     (from Loops.so)                                   │          │
│                                                        ▼          │
│   Candidate App (frontend:3000)                    Token Link     │
│     ├─ Token verification                                        │
│     ├─ Registration & permissions                               │
│     ├─ Voice interview UI                                       │
│     └─ Code editor + Screen recording                           │
│          │                                                        │
│          │ WebSocket + Daily.co                                  │
│          ▼                                                        │
│   Interview Backend (backend:8000)                              │
│     ├─ POST /api/v1/connect                                    │
│     │    ├─ Creates Daily.co room & token                      │
│     │    ├─ Spawns bot subprocess (bot_defaults.py)            │
│     │    └─ Returns room_url + bot_token                       │
│     │                                                            │
│     └─ Pipecat Bot (subprocess)                                │
│          ├─ Real-time voice interaction via Daily.co           │
│          ├─ STT: Deepgram (speech-to-text)                    │
│          ├─ LLM: Gemini/GPT-4/Groq (understanding)             │
│          ├─ TTS: ElevenLabs/Cartesia (voice output)            │
│          ├─ Interview flow execution                            │
│          ├─ Response evaluation                                 │
│          └─ Transcript generation                              │
│                                                                   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│           INTER-SERVICE COMMUNICATION PATTERNS                   │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                                   │
│ • Recruiter Dashboard → Recruiter API: REST (fetch/POST/PUT)    │
│ • Recruiter API → Supabase: SDK calls (CRUD)                    │
│ • Recruiter API → Loops: SMTP email send                        │
│ • Recruiter API → AWS S3: boto3 recording upload/retrieval      │
│ • Frontend → Interview Backend: WebSocket (Daily.co)            │
│ • Interview Backend → Supabase: SDK calls (read interview data)│
│ • Pipecat Bot → LLM APIs: HTTP/gRPC (Gemini, OpenAI, Groq)    │
│ • Pipecat Bot → STT/TTS: HTTP (Deepgram, ElevenLabs)           │
│ • Phone Scheduler → External Calendar API: Scheduling          │
│                                                                   │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

### Key Communication Patterns:

1. **Candidate Interview Session**:
   - Frontend connects to `backend:8000/api/v1/connect` via HTTP
   - Backend creates Daily.co room and spawns Python subprocess running bot
   - Frontend opens WebSocket to Daily.co room
   - Pipecat bot uses WebSocket to communicate with candidate in real-time
   - Bot processes speech via Deepgram (STT) → LLM → TTS → Audio output

2. **Recruiter Operations**:
   - Dashboard calls Recruiter API (`flowterview-backend:8010`) via REST
   - API persists data to Supabase PostgreSQL
   - API sends emails via Loops.so SMTP
   - API manages recordings via AWS S3

3. **Data Flow**:
   - Interview configuration stored in Supabase
   - Candidate responses stored in Supabase via Interview Backend
   - Recordings uploaded to S3, served via CloudFront
   - Transcripts and evaluations stored in Supabase
